item.title: Cloud Functions Simple(st) HTTP Multi-host Proxy
item.description: Tweaked yesterday’s solution so that it will randomly select one from several hosts with which it’s configured. package proxy import ( "log" "math/rand" "net/http" "net/url" "os" "strings" "time" ) func robin() { hostsList := os.Getenv("PROXY_HOST") if hostsList == "" { log.Fatal("'PROXY_HOST' environment variable should contain comma-separated list of hosts") } // Comma-separated lists of hosts hosts := strings.Split(hostsList, ",") urls := make([]*url.URL, len(hosts)) for i, host := range hosts { var origin = Endpoint{ Host: host, Port: os.

item.title: Cloud Functions Simple(st) HTTP Proxy
item.description: I’m investigating the use of LetsEncrypt for gRPC services. I found this straightforward post by Scott Devoid and am going to try this approach. Before I can do that, I need to be able to publish services (make them Internet-accessible) and would like to try to continue to use GCP for free. Some time ago, I wrote about using the excellent Microk8s on GCP. Using an f1-micro, I’m hoping (!) to stay within the Compute Engine free tier.
